thread.title: Expanded EPC South football statistical leaders through six weeks
thread.title_full: Expanded EPC South football statistical leaders through six weeks - The Morning Call

author: Stephen Miller
title: Expanded EPC South football statistical leaders through six weeks
text:
Emmaus senior Kyle Boney needed a decent game against Northampton to become the EPC South's first 1,000-yard rusher this season.
He blew past that mark with another monster game.
Boney needed just 15 carries to pile up 221 yards and three touchdowns against the Konkrete Kids. He has a division-best 1,147 rushing yards heading into a Week 7 meeting with Central Catholic.
Four quarterbacks have thrown for 1,000 yards through the season's first six weeks. Liberty's Doug Erney tops the division in touchdown passes with 17, one ahead of Nazareth's Travis Stefanik.
Nazareth's duo of Julian Liaci and Jahan Dotson continue to sit 1-2 in the division in catches. Dotson tops the EPC South in receiving yards with 626.
Here's the full rundown of leaders.
RUSHING LEADERS
Freedom High football team enters 4A state rankings, Parkland tumbles out Stephen Miller The last unbeaten football team in the EPC South Division has jumped into the Patriot-News/Pennlive Class 4A state poll.
Freedom enters the rankings at No. 9 after spending much of the season listed as a team to watch. Woodland Hills, Pine-Richland, Central Dauphin, North Allegheny and Pittsburgh...

It had nothing to do with Northestern's opponent, Salisbury, the next night.
But it had everything to do what was likely going to transpire during that game.
Hall was 141 yards...
